While reducing political polarization may not guarantee that individuals will automatically address root causes of societal issues collaboratively, it can create a foundation for constructive dialogue and problem-solving. When polarization is high, individuals are more likely to retreat into echo chambers and resist engaging with differing perspectives. By fostering a less polarized environment, we increase the likelihood of individuals being open to considering alternative viewpoints and working together towards solutions. This increased openness can facilitate discussions around the root causes of division and lead to more effective and sustainable outcomes.
